Eligibility: Patients with Stage II or III breast cancer
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status greater than or equal to 1.
A prior treatment with herceptin, taxanes, doxorubicin or other anthracycline-type treatments, navelbine or platinum.
A serious illness or a medical or psychiatric disorder
Active or serious cardiovascular or pulmonary diseases
Patients with left ventricular ejection fraction < 50%
- Peripheral neuropathy of any etiology greater than Class 1
Results: · Complete pathological response after preoperative treatment with Herceptin/Navellibine versus Taxotere/Carboplatin/Herceptin in patients with early positive breast cancer HER-2
The complete pathological response is defined as the complete disappearance of the invasive tumour in the breast at the time of surgery.
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 17
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 31
